Posts.Content: Sep 13, 2012 12:30PM tamD wrote: I am also scheduled for surgery on Oct 16, am ER+3 PR+ as well and was told by my oncologist and BS to come off 2 weeks before and 2 after.  My oncologist said that the they want at least 80% compliance with tamoxifen use in the 5 years for its effectiveness.  I was looking for a study to see if 80% compliance is good enough.  I certainly take it everyday religiously and figure if I am not going to take it daily then I need something else in place -- except I will come off for the surgery.  I have read somewhere that it is in our bodies for 6 weeks.  Someone might know better. This is the link where I think they compared full compliance, no tamoxifen and 80% compliance. http://www.cancercentre.ox.ac.uk/news/drug2019s-lasting-benefits-sees-breast-cancer-deaths-down-by-third
